member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.UnreachableException
member.summary: Exception thrown when the program executes an instruction that was thought to be unreachable.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.UnreachableException.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the default error message.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.UnreachableException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message.
member.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.UnreachableException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
member.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.AllowNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that null is allowed as an input even if the corresponding type disallows it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DisallowNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that null is disallowed as an input even if the corresponding type allows it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MaybeNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that an output may be null even if the corresponding type disallows it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that an output will not be null even if the corresponding type allows it. Specifies that an input argument was not null when the call returns.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MaybeNullWhenAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that when a method returns , the parameter may be null even if the corresponding type disallows it.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MaybeNullWhenAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the specified return value condition.
member.param: The return value condition. If the method returns this value, the associated parameter may be .

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MaybeNullWhenAttribute.ReturnValue
member.summary: Gets the return value condition.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullWhenAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that when a method returns , the parameter will not be null even if the corresponding type allows it.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullWhenAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the specified return value condition.
member.param: The return value condition. If the method returns this value, the associated parameter will not be .

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullWhenAttribute.ReturnValue
member.summary: Gets the return value condition.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullIfNotNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that the output will be non-null if the named parameter is non-null.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullIfNotNullAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the associated parameter name.
member.param: The associated parameter name. The output will be non-null if the argument to the parameter specified is non-null.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullIfNotNullAttribute.ParameterName
member.summary: Gets the associated parameter name.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnAttribute
member.summary: Applied to a method that will never return under any circumstance.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnIfAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that the method will not return if the associated Boolean parameter is passed the specified value.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnIfAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the specified parameter value.
member.param: The condition parameter value. Code after the method will be considered unreachable by diagnostics if the argument to the associated parameter matches this value.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnIfAttribute.ParameterValue
member.summary: Gets the condition parameter value.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullAttribute

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullWhenAttribute

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicallyAccessedMembersAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that certain members on a specified are accessed dynamically, for example through .
member.remarks:
This allows tools to understand which members are being accessed during the execution of a program.
This attribute is valid on members whose type is or .
When this attribute is applied to a location of type , the assumption is that the string represents a fully qualified type name.
When this attribute is applied to a class, interface, or struct, the members specified can be accessed dynamically on instances returned from calling on instances of that class, interface, or struct.
If the attribute is applied to a method it's treated as a special case and it implies the attribute should be applied to the "this" parameter of the method. As such the attribute should only be used on instance methods of types assignable to System.Type (or string, but no methods will use it there).

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicallyAccessedMembersAttribute.#ctor(System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicallyAccessedMemberTypes)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified member types.
member.param: The types of members dynamically accessed.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicallyAccessedMembersAttribute.MemberTypes
member.summary: Gets the which specifies the type of members dynamically accessed.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicallyAccessedMemberTypes
member.summary:
Specifies the types of members that are dynamically accessed.
This enumeration has a attribute that allows a bitwise combination of its member values.

member.summary: Specifies no members.

member.summary: Specifies all public methods.

member.summary: Specifies all non-public methods.

member.summary: Specifies all public fields.

member.summary: Specifies all non-public fields.

member.summary: Specifies all public nested types.

member.summary: Specifies all non-public nested types.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.RequiresDynamicCodeAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the specified method requires the ability to generate new code at runtime, for example through .
member.remarks: This allows tools to understand which methods are unsafe to call when compiling ahead of time.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.RequiresDynamicCodeAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified message.
member.param: A message that contains information about the usage of dynamic code.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.RequiresDynamicCodeAttribute.Message
member.summary: Gets a message that contains information about the usage of dynamic code.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.RequiresDynamicCodeAttribute.Url
member.summary: Gets or sets an optional URL that contains more information about the method, why it requires dynamic code, and what options a consumer has to deal with it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.RequiresUnreferencedCodeAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the specified method requires dynamic access to code that is not referenced statically, for example through .
member.remarks: This allows tools to understand which methods are unsafe to call when removing unreferenced code from an application.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.RequiresUnreferencedCodeAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified message.
member.param: A message that contains information about the usage of unreferenced code.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.RequiresUnreferencedCodeAttribute.Message
member.summary: Gets a message that contains information about the usage of unreferenced code.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.RequiresUnreferencedCodeAttribute.Url
member.summary: Gets or sets an optional URL that contains more information about the method, why it requires unreferenced code, and what options a consumer has to deal with it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute
member.summary: /// Suppresses reporting of a specific rule violation, allowing multiple suppressions on a single code artifact.
member.remarks: is different than in that it doesn't have a . So it is always preserved in the compiled assembly.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, specifying the category of the tool and the identifier for an analysis rule.
member.param: The category for the attribute.
The identifier of the analysis rule the attribute applies to.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute.Category
member.summary: Gets the category identifying the classification of the attribute.
member.remarks: The property describes the tool or tool analysis category for which a message suppression attribute applies.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute.CheckId
member.summary: Gets the identifier of the analysis tool rule to be suppressed.
member.remarks: Concatenated together, the and properties form a unique check identifier.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute.Scope
member.summary: Gets or sets the scope of the code that is relevant for the attribute.
member.remarks: The Scope property is an optional argument that specifies the metadata scope for which the attribute is relevant.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute.Target
member.summary: Gets or sets a fully qualified path that represents the target of the attribute.
member.remarks: The property is an optional argument identifying the analysis target of the attribute. An example value is "System.IO.Stream.ctor():System.Void". Because it is fully qualified, it can be long, particularly for targets such as parameters. The analysis tool user interface should be capable of automatically formatting the parameter.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute.MessageId
member.summary: Gets or sets an optional argument expanding on exclusion criteria.
member.remarks: The property is an optional argument that specifies additional exclusion where the literal metadata target is not sufficiently precise. For example, the cannot be applied within a method, and it may be desirable to suppress a violation against a statement in the method that will give a rule violation, but not against all statements in the method.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute.Justification
member.summary: Gets or sets the justification for suppressing the code analysis message.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Shared.Diagnostics.Throw

member.remarks: The main purpose is to reduce code size, improve performance, and standardize exception messages.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Agents.AI.AIAgentExtensions.AsBuilder(Microsoft.Agents.AI.AIAgent)
member.summary: Creates a new using the specified agent as the foundation for the builder pipeline.
member.param: The instance to use as the inner agent.
member.returns: A new instance configured with the specified inner agent.
member.remarks: This method provides a convenient way to convert an existing instance into a builder pattern, enabling easily wrapping the agent in layers of additional functionality. It is functionally equivalent to using the constructor directly, but provides a more fluent API when working with existing agent instances.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Agents.AI.AIAgentExtensions.AsAIFunction(Microsoft.Agents.AI.AIAgent,Microsoft.Extensions.AI.AIFunctionFactoryOptions,Microsoft.Agents.AI.AgentThread)
member.summary: Creates an that runs the provided .
member.param: The to be represented as an invocable function.
Optional metadata to customize the function representation, such as name and description. If not provided, defaults will be inferred from the agent's properties.
Optional to use for function invocations. If not provided, a new thread will be created for each function call, which may not preserve conversation context.
member.returns: An that can be used as a tool by other agents or AI models to invoke this agent.

remarks.para: This extension method enables agents to participate in function calling scenarios, where they can be invoked as tools by other agents or AI models. The resulting function accepts a query string as input and returns the agent's response as a string, making it compatible with standard function calling interfaces used by AI models.

The resulting is stateful, referencing both the and the optional . Especially if a specific thread is provided, avoid using the resulting function concurrently in multiple conversations or in requests where the parallel function calls may result in concurrent usage of the thread, as that could lead to undefined and unpredictable behavior.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Agents.AI.AIAgentExtensions.SanitizeAgentName(System.String)
member.summary: Removes characters from AI agent name that shouldn't be used in an AI function name.
member.param: The AI agent name to sanitize.
member.returns: The sanitized agent name with invalid characters replaced by underscores, or null if the input is null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Agents.AI.AIAgentExtensions.InvalidNameCharsRegex
member.summary: Regex that flags any character other than ASCII digits or letters.

remarks.para: For Native AOT or applications disabling , this instance includes source generated contracts for all common exchange types contained in this library.

It additionally turns on the following settings:
Enables defaults.
Enables as the default ignore condition for properties.
Enables as the default number handling for number types.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Agents.AI.AIAgentBuilder.Use(System.Func{Microsoft.Agents.AI.AIAgent,System.IServiceProvider,Microsoft.Agents.AI.AIAgent})
member.summary: Adds a factory for an intermediate agent to the agent pipeline.
member.param: The agent factory function.

member.summary: Adds to the agent pipeline an anonymous delegating agent based on a delegate that provides an implementation for both and .
member.param: A delegate that provides the implementation for both and . This delegate is invoked with the list of messages, the agent thread, the run options, a delegate that represents invoking the inner agent, and a cancellation token. The delegate should be passed whatever messages, thread, options, and cancellation token should be passed along to the next stage in the pipeline. It will handle both the non-streaming and streaming cases.
member.remarks: This overload can be used when the anonymous implementation needs to provide pre-processing and/or post-processing, but doesn't need to interact with the results of the operation, which will come from the inner agent.

member.summary: Adds to the agent pipeline an anonymous delegating agent based on a delegate that provides an implementation for both and .
member.param: A delegate that provides the implementation for . When , must be non-null, and the implementation of will use for the implementation.
A delegate that provides the implementation for . When , must be non-null, and the implementation of will use for the implementation.
member.remarks: One or both delegates can be provided. If both are provided, they will be used for their respective methods: will provide the implementation of , and will provide the implementation of . If only one of the delegates is provided, it will be used for both methods. That means that if is supplied without , the implementation of will employ limited streaming, as it will be operating on the batch output produced by . And if is supplied without , the implementation of will be implemented by combining the updates from .

member.name: T:Microsoft.Agents.AI.AIAgentBuilder.EmptyServiceProvider
member.summary: Provides an empty implementation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Agents.AI.AIAgentBuilder.EmptyServiceProvider.Instance
member.summary: Gets the singleton instance of .

member.name: T:Microsoft.Agents.AI.AIAgentBuilderExtensions
member.summary: Provides extension methods for configuring and customizing instances.
Adds function invocation callbacks to the pipeline that intercepts and processes calls.
member.param: The to which the function invocation callback is added.

A delegate that processes function invocations. The delegate receives the instance, the function invocation context, and a continuation delegate representing the next callback in the pipeline. It returns a task representing the result of the function invocation.
member.returns: The instance with the function invocation callback added, enabling method chaining.

remarks.para: The callback must call the provided continuation delegate to proceed with the function invocation, unless it intends to completely replace the function's behavior.
The inner agent or the pipeline wrapping it must include a . If one does not exist, the added to the pipline by this method will throw an exception when it is invoked.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Agents.AI.AIAgentBuilderExtensions.UseOpenTelemetry(Microsoft.Agents.AI.AIAgentBuilder,System.String,System.Action{Microsoft.Agents.AI.OpenTelemetryAgent})
member.summary: Adds OpenTelemetry instrumentation to the agent pipeline, enabling comprehensive observability for agent operations.
member.param: The to which OpenTelemetry support will be added.
An optional source name that will be used to identify telemetry data from this agent. If not specified, a default source name will be used.
An optional callback that provides additional configuration of the instance. This allows for fine-tuning telemetry behavior such as enabling sensitive data collection.
member.returns: The with OpenTelemetry instrumentation added, enabling method chaining.

remarks.para:
This extension adds comprehensive telemetry capabilities to AI agents, including:
Distributed tracing of agent invocations
Performance metrics and timing information
Request and response payload logging (when enabled)
Error tracking and exception details
Usage statistics and token consumption metrics
The implementation follows the OpenTelemetry Semantic Conventions for Generative AI systems as defined at .

Note: The OpenTelemetry specification for Generative AI is still experimental and subject to change. As the specification evolves, the telemetry output from this agent may also change to maintain compliance.

A delegate that provides the implementation for both and . In addition to the arguments for the operation, it's provided with a delegate to the inner agent that should be used to perform the operation on the inner agent. It will handle both the non-streaming and streaming cases.
member.remarks: This overload may be used when the anonymous implementation needs to provide pre-processing and/or post-processing, but doesn't need to interact with the results of the operation, which will come from the inner agent.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The inner agent.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Agents.AI.ChatClientAgent.#ctor(Microsoft.Extensions.AI.IChatClient,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IList{Microsoft.Extensions.AI.AITool},Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.ILoggerFactory,System.IServiceProvider)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The chat client to use when running the agent.
Optional system instructions that guide the agent's behavior. These instructions are provided to the with each invocation to establish the agent's role and behavior.
Optional name for the agent. This name is used for identification and logging purposes.
Optional human-readable description of the agent's purpose and capabilities. This description can be useful for documentation and agent discovery scenarios.
Optional collection of tools that the agent can invoke during conversations. These tools augment any tools that may be provided to the agent via when the agent is run.
Optional logger factory for creating loggers used by the agent and its components.

Optional service provider for resolving dependencies required by AI functions and other agent components. This is particularly important when using custom tools that require dependency injection. This is only relevant when the doesn't already contain a and the needs to insert one.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The chat client to use when running the agent.
Configuration options that control all aspects of the agent's behavior, including chat settings, message store factories, context provider factories, and other advanced configurations.
Optional logger factory for creating loggers used by the agent and its components.

Optional service provider for resolving dependencies required by AI functions and other agent components. This is particularly important when using custom tools that require dependency injection. This is only relevant when the doesn't already contain a and the needs to insert one.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Agents.AI.ChatClientAgent.ChatClient
member.summary: Gets the underlying chat client used by the agent to invoke chat completions.
member.value: The instance that backs this agent.
member.remarks: This may return the original client provided when the was constructed, or it may return a pipeline of decorating instances applied around that inner client.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Agents.AI.ChatClientAgent.Instructions
member.summary: Gets the system instructions that guide the agent's behavior during conversations.
member.value: A string containing the system instructions that are provided to the underlying chat client to establish the agent's role, personality, and behavioral guidelines. May be if no specific instructions were configured.
member.remarks: These instructions are typically provided to the AI model as system messages to establish the context and expected behavior for the agent's responses.

member.summary: Configures the specified instance based on the provided run options and chat options.
member.remarks: This method applies transformations and customizations to the chat client and chat options based on the provided . If no applicable options are provided, the original is returned unchanged.
member.param: The run options to apply. If is of type , additional configuration such as tool transformations and custom chat client creation may be applied.
The instance to configure. If a custom chat client factory is provided in , a new instance may be created.
member.returns: The configured instance. If a custom chat client factory is used, the returned instance may differ from the input .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Agents.AI.ChatClientAgent.GetNewThread(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new agent thread instance using an existing conversation identifier to continue that conversation.
member.param: The identifier of an existing conversation to continue.
member.returns: A new instance configured to work with the specified conversation.

remarks.para: This method creates threads that rely on server-side conversation storage, where the chat history is maintained by the underlying AI service rather than in local message stores.
Agent threads created with this method will only work with instances that support server-side conversation storage through their underlying .

member.summary: Notify the when an agent run succeeded, if there is an .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Agents.AI.ChatClientAgent.CreateConfiguredChatOptions(Microsoft.Agents.AI.AgentRunOptions)
member.summary: Configures and returns chat options by merging the provided run options with the agent's default chat options.
member.remarks: This method prioritizes the chat options provided in over the agent's default chat options. Any unset properties in the run options will be filled using the agent's chat options. If both are , the method returns .
member.param: Optional run options that may include specific chat configuration settings.
member.returns: A object representing the merged chat configuration, or if neither the run options nor the agent's chat options are available.

member.summary: Run the agent with no message assuming that all required instructions are already provided to the agent or on the thread, and requesting a response of the specified type .
member.param: The conversation thread to use for this invocation. If , a new thread will be created. The thread will be updated with any response messages generated during invocation.
The JSON serialization options to use.
Optional configuration parameters for controlling the agent's invocation behavior.

to set a JSON schema on the ; otherwise, . The default is . Using a JSON schema improves reliability if the underlying model supports native structured output with a schema, but might cause an error if the model does not support it.
The to monitor for cancellation requests. The default is .
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result contains an with the agent's output.
member.remarks: This overload is useful when the agent has sufficient context from previous messages in the thread or from its initial configuration to generate a meaningful response without additional input.

to set a JSON schema on the ; otherwise, . The default is . Using a JSON schema improves reliability if the underlying model supports native structured output with a schema, but might cause an error if the model does not support it.

member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result contains an with the agent's output.
member.exception: is , empty, or contains only whitespace.

to set a JSON schema on the ; otherwise, . The default is . Using a JSON schema improves reliability if the underlying model supports native structured output with a schema, but might cause an error if the model does not support it.

member.summary: Runs the agent with a collection of chat messages, requesting a response of the specified type .
member.param: The collection of messages to send to the agent for processing.
The conversation thread to use for this invocation. If , a new thread will be created. The thread will be updated with the input messages and any response messages generated during invocation.
The JSON serialization options to use.
Optional configuration parameters for controlling the agent's invocation behavior.

to set a JSON schema on the ; otherwise, . The default is . Using a JSON schema improves reliability if the underlying model supports native structured output with a schema, but might cause an error if the model does not support it.
The to monitor for cancellation requests. The default is .
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result contains an with the agent's output.
member.typeparam: The type of structured output to request.

remarks.para: This is the primary invocation method that implementations must override. It handles collections of messages, allowing for complex conversational scenarios including multi-turn interactions, function calls, and context-rich conversations.
The messages are processed in the order provided and become part of the conversation history. The agent's response will also be added to if one is provided.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Agents.AI.ChatClientAgentRunOptions.#ctor(Microsoft.Extensions.AI.ChatOptions)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Optional chat options to customize the behavior of the chat client during this specific agent invocation. These options will be merged with the default chat options configured for the agent.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Agents.AI.ChatClientAgentRunOptions.ChatOptions
member.summary: Gets or sets the chat options to apply to the agent invocation.
member.value: Chat options that control various aspects of the chat client's behavior, such as temperature, max tokens, tools, instructions, and other model-specific parameters. If , the agent's default chat options will be used.
member.remarks: These options are specific to this invocation and will be combined with the agent's default chat options. If both the agent and this run options specify the same option, the run options value typically takes precedence. In the case of collections, like , the collections will be unioned.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Agents.AI.ChatClientAgentRunOptions.ChatClientFactory
member.summary: Gets or sets a factory function that can replace (typically via decorators) the chat client on a per-request basis.
member.value: A function that receives the agent's configured chat client and returns a potentially modified or entirely different chat client to use for this specific invocation. If , the agent's default chat client will be used without modification.

member.summary: Represents the response of the specified type to an run request.
member.typeparam: The type of value expected from the chat response.
member.remarks: Language models are not guaranteed to honor the requested schema. If the model's output is not parsable as the expected type, you can access the underlying JSON response on the property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Agents.AI.ChatClientAgentThread.ConversationId
member.summary: Gets or sets the ID of the underlying service thread to support cases where the chat history is stored by the agent service.

remarks.para: Note that either or may be set, but not both. If is not null, and is set, will be reverted to null, and vice versa.

This property may be null in the following cases:
The thread stores messages via the and not in the agent service.
This thread object is new and a server managed thread has not yet been created in the agent service.
The id may also change over time where the id is pointing at a agent service managed thread, and the default behavior of a service is to fork the thread with each iteration.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Agents.AI.ChatClientAgentThread.MessageStore
member.summary: Gets or sets the used by this thread, for cases where messages should be stored in a custom location.

remarks.para: Note that either or may be set, but not both. If is not null, and is set, will be reverted to null, and vice versa.

This property may be null in the following cases:
The thread stores messages in the agent service and just has an id to the remove thread, instead of in an .
This thread object is new it is not yet clear whether it will be backed by a server managed thread or an .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Agents.AI.ChatClientAgentThread.AIContextProvider
member.summary: Gets or sets the used by this thread to provide additional context to the AI model before each invocation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Agents.AI.Data.TextSearchProvider
member.summary: A text search context provider that performs a search over external knowledge and injects the formatted results into the AI invocation context, or exposes a search tool for on-demand use. This provider can be used to enable Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) on an agent.

remarks.para:
The provider supports two behaviors controlled via :
Automatically performs a search prior to every AI invocation and injects results as additional instructions.
Exposes a function tool that the model may invoke to retrieve contextual information when needed.

When is greater than zero the provider will retain the most recent user and assistant messages (up to the configured limit) across invocations and prepend them (in chronological order) to the current request messages when forming the search input. This can improve search relevance by providing multi-turn context to the retrieval layer without permanently altering the conversation history.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Delegate that executes the search logic. Must not be .
Optional configuration options.
Optional logger factory.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from previously serialized state.
member.param: Delegate that executes the search logic. Must not be .
A representing the serialized provider state.
Optional serializer options (unused - source generated context is used).
Optional configuration options.
Optional logger factory.
member.remarks: Only overridden prompts (function name, function description, context prompt, citations prompt) are restored. If a value was not persisted or matches the defaults it will fall back to the built-in defaults. Custom delegates are not serialized.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Agents.AI.Data.TextSearchProvider.Serialize(System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions)
member.summary: Serializes the current provider state to a containing any overridden prompts or descriptions.
member.param: Optional serializer options (ignored, source generated context is used).
member.returns: A with overridden values, or default if nothing was overridden.

member.summary: Gets or sets the context prompt prefixed to automatically injected results.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Agents.AI.Data.TextSearchProviderOptions.ContextFormatter
member.summary: Optional delegate to fully customize formatting of the result list.
member.remarks: If provided, and are ignored.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Agents.AI.Data.TextSearchProviderOptions.RecentMessageMemoryLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of recent conversation messages (both user and assistant) to keep in memory and include when constructing the search input for searches.
member.value: The maximum number of most recent messages to retain. A value of 0 (default) disables memory and only the current request's messages are used for search input. The value is a count of individual messages, not turns. Only messages with role or are retained.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Agents.AI.Data.TextSearchProviderOptions.TextSearchBehavior.BeforeAIInvoke
member.summary: Execute search prior to each invocation and inject results as instructions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Agents.AI.Data.TextSearchProviderOptions.TextSearchBehavior.OnDemandFunctionCalling
member.summary: Expose a function tool to perform search on-demand via function/tool calling.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Agents.AI.OpenTelemetryAgent
member.summary: Provides a delegating implementation that implements the OpenTelemetry Semantic Conventions for Generative AI systems.
member.remarks: This class provides an implementation of the Semantic Conventions for Generative AI systems v1.37, defined at . The specification is still experimental and subject to change; as such, the telemetry output by this client is also subject to change.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Agents.AI.OpenTelemetryAgent._otelClient
member.summary: The providing the bulk of the telemetry.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Agents.AI.OpenTelemetryAgent._providerName
member.summary: The provider name extracted from .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Agents.AI.OpenTelemetryAgent.#ctor(Microsoft.Agents.AI.AIAgent,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The underlying to be augmented with telemetry capabilities.
An optional source name that will be used to identify telemetry data from this agent. If not provided, a default source name will be used for telemetry identification.
member.remarks: The constructor automatically extracts provider metadata from the inner agent and configures telemetry collection according to OpenTelemetry semantic conventions for AI systems.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Agents.AI.OpenTelemetryAgent.EnableSensitiveData
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether potentially sensitive information should be included in telemetry.
member.value: if potentially sensitive information should be included in telemetry; if telemetry shouldn't include raw inputs and outputs. The default value is , unless the OTEL_INSTRUMENTATION_GENAI_CAPTURE_MESSAGE_CONTENT environment variable is set to "true" (case-insensitive).
member.remarks: By default, telemetry includes metadata, such as token counts, but not raw inputs and outputs, such as message content, function call arguments, and function call results. The default value can be overridden by setting the OTEL_INSTRUMENTATION_GENAI_CAPTURE_MESSAGE_CONTENT environment variable to "true". Explicitly setting this property will override the environment variable.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Agents.AI.OpenTelemetryAgent.UpdateCurrentActivity(System.Diagnostics.Activity)
member.summary: Augments the current activity created by the with agent-specific information.
member.param: The that was current prior to the 's invocation.

member.summary: Build a from the pipeline described by this .
member.param: A builder for creating pipelines of .
Optional system instructions that guide the agent's behavior. These instructions are provided to the with each invocation to establish the agent's role and behavior.
Optional name for the agent. This name is used for identification and logging purposes.
Optional human-readable description of the agent's purpose and capabilities. This description can be useful for documentation and agent discovery scenarios.
Optional collection of tools that the agent can invoke during conversations. These tools augment any tools that may be provided to the agent via when the agent is run.
Optional logger factory for creating loggers used by the agent and its components.
Optional service provider for resolving dependencies required by AI functions and other agent components. This is particularly important when using custom tools that require dependency injection.

member.param: A builder for creating pipelines of .
Configuration options that control all aspects of the agent's behavior, including chat settings, message store factories, context provider factories, and other advanced configurations.
Optional logger factory for creating loggers used by the agent and its components.
Optional service provider for resolving dependencies required by AI functions and other agent components. This is particularly important when using custom tools that require dependency injection.
